info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 1 at 5:44PM MST until July 1 at 8:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Areas near Paulden and Chino Valley.
* WHEN...Until 845 PM MST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. Water flowing over roadways will create slick roads and muddy unpaved roads. Ponding of water on interstates, highways and in urban areas will create hazardous travel conditions.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 543 PM MST, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1 and 2.25 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Walnut Creek, Dillon Wash, Williamson Valley Wash, Granite Creek, Butte Wash, Pine Creek, Bottleneck Wash, Little Chino Valley, Antelope Wash, Quartz Lead Wash, Verde River, Cooper Wash, Mud Tank Wash, Big Chino Wash and Mint Wash. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chino Valley, Prescott, Sullivan Buttes, Paulden, Williamson Valley and Granite Mountain Wilderness. - This includes State Route 89 between mile markers 325 and 339. - Additional information is available at weather.gov/flagstaff.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Low water crossings will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MST THIS EVENING
